intro: Congea rockii, commonly known as the rock congea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and oval-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in rocky or well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
